title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire Damage Correction - 09/17/2022 INC#0289

item.description: Update Damage Correction - Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0289; 01:00PM; 9000 W Venice Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LoI3aw; #Palms; As the investigation and clean-up continues at the scene of this morning's Major Emergency Structure Fire, it is now clear that direct fire damage was limited to *five* adjoining businesses, including (from east to west) a nail salon, smoke shop, martial arts studio, staffing agency, and pet boarding. Collateral smoke, heat and water damage affected the adjacent jewelry store to the east, and a restaurant at the west end of the building. All *seven* of those affected businesses were under one roof and shared a common attic. None of the businesses were equipped with optional fire sprinklers. The injured firefighter continues to receive medical assessment and treatment at an area hospital for his sudden illness. For additional information and imagery regarding the fire, please see https://LAFD.ORG/NEWS; - Brian Humphrey

title.a: Traffic Advisory - Major Emergency Structure Fire 09/17/2022 INC#0289

item.description: Traffic Advisory - Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0289; 12:00PM; 9000 W Venice Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LoI3aw; #Palms; Travel on Venice Boulevard between Robertson Boulevard and Culver Boulevard will be limited to only one westbound lane this afternoon, as firefighters and investigators continue to work the scene of a major emergency structure fire that was extinguished this morning in the Palms area near the Culver City limits. The closure of lanes will continue until LAFD operations are complete, with an unknown duration. Significant traffic congestion and delay are being experienced in the immediate area. Motorists should consider an alternate route, with detours readily available. Please monitor traffic reports on news radio. Transit Users Follow @MetroLAAlerts https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts on Twitter for any service delays. For additional information regarding the fire, please see https://LAFD.ORG/NEWS; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Fatality Vehicle Fire - Now Out 09/17/2022 INC#0245

item.description: Fatality Vehicle Fire - Now Out; INC#0245; 04:34AM; 8221 N Vantage Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3eXqC55; #SunValley; 24 Firefighters arrived quickly to find and extinguish (4:51 AM) a 25' travel trailer parked in a driveway area between two homes, well involved with fire. Firefighters held flames to the trailer, with heat damage to the eaves of both adjacent homes. The remains of an adult male were subsequently discovered within the charred remnants of the recreational vehicle. The fire's cause remains under active investigation. Media Inquiries: LAFD, LAPD (Incident #772) and Coroner.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AR1 BC14 E260 E289 E77 E81 RA89 T60 T89; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire 09/17/2022 INC#0289

item.description: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0289; 06:57AM; 9000 W Venice Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LoI3aw; #Palms; 124 LAFD Firefighters took just 73 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire that directly involved three businesses in a 50' x 400' one-story row of a dozen commercial occupancies. Heavy smoke impacted at least a half-dozen adjacent businesses, including a feline overnight boarding facility where several cats were rescued, but others sadly perished. Though there were no civilian injuries, one firefighter took ill during the intense firefight, and has been taken to an area hospital in fair condition for observation. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. LAFD Public Information Officer, Firefighter David Ortiz is en route, ETA 8:00 AM.; FS 43; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; AR11 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC4 BC5 BC9 CM20 CM22 E205 E210 E211 E229 E261 E263 E27 E292 E294 E295 E34 E37 E43 E59 E61 E62 E94 EA1 EM11 EM9 HR3 RA43 RA5 RA92 RA94 T10 T11 T29 T5 T61 T63 T92 T94 T95 UR5 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0301; 07:13AM; 1536 E 102nd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3S8gvIY; Watts; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighter extinguished the fire in 23 minutes with no injuries reported. Firefighters located and contained the fire within two hallways in the structure, preventing it from extending throughout. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 E233 E264 E64 E65 RA264 RA64 RA865 T33 T64; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart
